data.message: Hey Coca-Cola, we made a new and improved version of your video - hope you enjoy! 🎅🎁🎄 #EndOceanPlastics

replies.message: Boring

It's people that dump bottles, not Coke, if you spent more time running campaigns asking people to recycle and spent your clear abundance of money on new recycling schemes rather than fear mongering videos, you might actually get somewhere instead of being ridiculed by the masses.
This is amazing! Go Greenpeace! Coke, how about you end your plastic pollution for Christmas 🎄
Its a bit pathetic init tbh. Its mostly down to the people that dump the bottles I can hardly see it down to actual manufacturers
Roasted lol

Top of my list for Christmas this year is for companies like Coca-Cola to #EndOceanPlastics 
110 BILLION new single-use bottles made by Coke each year! Come on! You can and must do better...
Awesome parody ad! Great work team Greenpeace UK 👏👏👏

Elliot Cornfield Yes, but who produces unsustainable, single-use bottles? Who has lobbied fervently against bottle-return schemes around the world for the last 40 years? Recycling schemes alone will not solve this problem, Coke needs to take responsibility https://www.theguardian.com/commentisfree/2017/may/02/plastic-bottles-coca-cola-recycling-coke
Hahahaha yessss

Elliot Cornfield One of the reasons it can't be down to individual consumers alone is that recycling systems wouldn't actually be able to cope if every single one of the plastic bottles corporations produce was recycled. Recycling can't solve this problem - we need to reduce the amount of plastic we're using, and that starts with the corporations who produce it. And as Sam Chetan-Welsh points out, Coke have done everything they can to stop bottle-return schemes, which would make a big difference.
Madeleine Haughton-Boakes Kim O'Byrne
Lol so if they don’t use plastic what are they gonna use? Glass? That will just end up with glass smashed everywhere. Good job.
boring boring Greenpeace should have spent your cash on something worthwhile
Yes!! #EndOceanPlastics

Alex Game Rather than glass they should be using plastic bottles that can easily be returned to be washed and re-used. The problem is the current single-use bottles that people either have to chuck away or recycle. Coke also use barely any recycled plastic in their bottles, which means they're constantly pumping more and more new plastic out into the world.

Erm.... Abit desperate are we Green Peace? 

How's it Cokes fault? They produce recyclable plastic for their drinks to go in. If people can't dispose of the bottles properly it isn't Cokes fault.

It's just made you the laughing stock.

Alex Lloyd as I've previously posted, this isn't about condoning Coke or supporting Coke, it's about condemning the method in which Green Peace puts across its messages, and the amount of money they waste on "green" terrorism and propaganda campaigns. The world is not perfect, a lot needs to be done, but the methods in which Green Peace chooses to operate should not be supported. This isn't how you make change, this is how you turn people against what's right, this kind of video only garners support for the company they are fighting against.
Is that the truckload of plastic that enters the ocean every single minute you're depicting Coca-Cola?
Not coke's Fault people have an option Called "recycling".
If you have bought a coke recently the they have put please recycle on the top of the lid and you cannot grumble about that they are tackling the issues with reminders
Love this Greenpeace UK! #EndOceanPlastics
I wonder how much Diesel your boat uses every time you use it? Not very environmentally friendly eh?
